title: 111_s345
content:
The "Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Reauthorization Act of 2009" amends the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 to include coral conservation. Any references to the previous act now refer to the updated version. The Act aims to protect forests and coral reefs. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. The Act aims to protect these areas and their resources. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems in protection efforts. Amendments involve adding these ecosystems to definitions and addressing impacts on countries. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems in protection efforts. The amendments define coral and coral reef, as well as associated coastal marine ecosystems important for maintaining ecological integrity. SEC. 4. CHANGE TO NAME OF FACILITY.

Section 804 of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename the "Tropical Forest Facility" to the "Conservation Facility". Conforming amendments are made to definitions to reflect this change in name.

SEC. 5. ELIGIBILITY FOR BENEFITS.

Section 805(a) of the Act is amended to include protection efforts for coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, expanding eligibility for benefits beyond tropical forests. SEC. 6. United States government representation on oversight bodies for grants from debt-for-nature swaps and debt buybacks. One or more individuals appointed by the United States Government may serve on the administering body overseeing grants from debt-for-nature swaps or debt buybacks. SEC. 7. Conservation agreements. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename agreements and eliminate the requirement to consult with the Enterprise for the Americas Board. The role of beneficiary countries is also revised to improve governance and management of tropical forests or coral reefs. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to enhance management of tropical forests, coral reefs, and associated coastal marine ecosystems. Grants over $250,000 require approval from the US and beneficiary country governments. Technical amendments include expanding the scope to include coral reefs and related ecosystems. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems in conservation agreements. Amendments also change the terminology from "Tropical Forest Agreement" to "Conservation Agreement". SEC. 8. CONSERVATION FUND. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename the "tropical forest fund" to "conservation fund" and make conforming amendments to definitions throughout the Act. The Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to rename the "Tropical Forest Fund" to "Conservation Fund" in various sections of the Act. SEC. 9 repeals the authority of the Enterprise for the Americas Board to carry out activities under the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009. SEC. 10 changes the due dates of annual reports to Congress. SEC. 10 amends the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 by changing the due dates of annual reports to Congress. SEC. 11 amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 regarding the International Monetary Fund criterion for country eligibility. SEC. 12 authorizes appropriations for debt reduction and audit expenses. Section 806 of the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009 is amended to allocate specific funding amounts for fiscal years 2009 to 2012. Additionally, $300,000 is authorized for audits, evaluations, monitoring, and administration of programs under this act.
